contentrichtext.text: <!-- Deleted image removed: [[Image:EliasLevy.png|thumb|right|Aleph One in 1996|{{deletable image-caption|1=Thursday, 10 September 2009}}]] --> '''Elias Levy''' (also known as '''Aleph One'''), was the moderator of the [[full disclosure]] vulnerability mailing list [[Bugtraq]] from May 14, 1996, until he stepped down on October 15, 2001. He was the CTO and co-founder of the computer security company [[SecurityFocus]], which was acquired by [[Symantec]] on August 6, 2002. He is also known as the author of the article "Smashing The Stack For Fun and Profit", published in 1996 ''[[Phrack]]'' magazine issue 49, which was the first high-quality, public, step-by-step introduction to [[stack buffer overflow]] vulnerabilities and their exploitation. After the sale of [[SecurityFocus]] to Symantec in August 2002, Levy was accused by many of "selling out" and compromising the high principles of the Bugtraq list. The "Full-Disclosure" mailing list was founded in part as a protest against the sale. ==External links== * [http://www.phrack.org/issues.html?issue=49&id=14#article "Smashing The Stack For Fun and Profit"] from 'Phrack' magazine * [http://www.archive.org/details/nc101_hackers Hackers], episode of NetCafe including an interview with Aleph One * [https://lists.grok.org.uk/mailman/listinfo/full-disclosure Full-Disclosure mailing list] * [http://www.networkcomputing.com/1119/1119f1people_8.html Network Computing feature] about Levy and Bugtraq {{Persondata <!-- Metadata: see [[Wikipedia:Persondata]]. --> | NAME = Levy, Elias | ALTERNATIVE NAMES = | SHORT DESCRIPTION = | DATE OF BIRTH = | PLACE OF BIRTH = | DATE OF DEATH = | PLACE OF DEATH = }} {{DEFAULTSORT:Levy, Elias}} [[Category:People associated with computer security|Levy E]] [[Category:Living people]] {{compu-bio-stub}}
